game.name: +Start Amiberry
game.desc: Configure Amiberry Amiga Emulator

game.name: +Start UAE4Arm
game.desc: Configure UAE4Arm Amiga Emulator

game.name: +Start DOSbox
game.desc: Configure DOSBox PC Emulator

game.name: +Start Reicast
game.desc: Configure Reicast Dreamcast Emulator

game.name: +Start RPIx86
game.desc: Configure RPIx86 PC Emulator

game.name: +Start Scummvm
game.desc: Configure ScummVM Emulator

game.name: Audio
game.desc: Configure audio settings. Choose default of auto, 3.5mm jack, or HDMI. Mixer controls, and apply default settings.

game.name: Bluetooth
game.desc: Register and connect to bluetooth devices. Unregister and remove devices, and display registered and connected devices.

game.name: Configuration Editor
game.desc: Change common RetroArch options, and manually edit RetroArch configs, global configs, and non-RetroArch configs.

game.name: File Manager
game.desc: Basic ascii file manager for linux allowing you to browse, copy, delete, and move files.

game.name: RetroArch Net Play
game.desc: Set up RetroArch Netplay options, choose host or client, port, host IP, delay frames, and your nickname.

game.name: Switch to Attract Mode
game.desc: Reboot into the Attract Mode front-end.

game.name: Run Command Configuration
game.desc: Change what appears on the runcommand screen. Enable or disable the menu, enable or disable box art, and change CPU configuration.

game.name: ES Collections
game.desc:
This script will dynamically create the custom collections game list file.
WARNING: This script only works if your ROMS are named according to the EmuMovies/HyperSpin/LaunchBox naming standard.
When ran, it will scan your various roms folder looking for the games that belong to the collection chosen. The script will create or update the Emulation Station custom gamelist file that is used by the collections menu items to show the games for it.
You do not have to add the custom collection prior to running the script.
Run the script and generate the collection of your choice then restart Emulation Station.
After restarting, enable the new collection via the GUI.
Press Start to bring up the menu Choose GAME COLLECTION SETTINGS Choose CUSTOM GAME COLLECTIONS
Enable the new collection and exit back out to the main menu. The new collection should now appear on the main menu.

game.name: ES Gamelist Utility
game.desc:
This script is for installing premade, prescraped Emulation Station gamelist.xml files. The script also provides a cleanup utility to audit existing gamelist.xml files against existing rom files to end up with a gamelist.xml file only containing entries for matching rom files.
The premade gamelist files are setup for No Intro filenames like EmuMovies, Hyperspin, Launchbox. They are also setup to use the four folders for PNG/MP4 media. boxart cart snap wheel
The premade gamelist files contain multiple entries per game to account for all known filename extensions supported by the particular system.

game.name: Media Removal Utility
game.desc:
This utility will remove any media files (boxart, cartart, snap, wheel) that exists that does not hvae a matching rom file.
This utility will only work if you are using the following folder structure.
boxart - boxart images cartart - cartart image snap - video snaps wheel - marquee or wheel images
You can select individual systems to remove excess media files.

game.name: Launching Screens
game.desc:
This script will enable or disable the use of launching screens.
Launching screensets are located here: /home/pi/RetroPie/LaunchingScreens
Each set of launching screens you have located there must be in their own parent folder, with the individual emulator system folders containing the launching.png files underneath.

game.name: GPIO Shutdown Utility
game.desc:
The GPIO shutdown script has already been installed on this base image.
This script will allow a momentary pusbutton to power on or power off the Raspberry Pi.
The script is setup to have the pushbutton wired to GPIO pins 5 and 6.
One press will shutdown and one press will power back on.

game.name: Steam config
game.desc: Configure steam

game.name: Switch Genesis-Megadrive
game.desc:
This script will switch between the Sega Genesis and the Sega Megadrive themes to show in the main menu.
You will need to restart Emulation Station after making the change.

game.name: RetroPie Reference
game.desc:
This is a quick reference for RetroPie information including Emulation Station, Attract Mode, RetroArch, and emulator ROM information.
You can quickly see emulator ROM information such as file locations, BIOS information, and rom filename extensions.
For the most up-to-date information, visit the official RetroPie wiki page.

game.name: RetroPie Jukebox
game.desc:
Turn your RetroPie into a music jukebox.
This is the fruitbox jukebox software by 'chundermike'.
Place your MP3 files into the /roms/jukebox folder to have them included.
There is a userguide.txt file for documentation located here: /home/pi/rpi-fruitbox-master
You can manually configure your controllers by adjusting the config file located here. /home/pi/rpi-fruitbox-master/skins/ /fruitbox.cfg

game.name: Media Downloader
game.desc: HP2 Media downloader (on sd only).

game.name: ES Themes
game.desc: Install, uninstall, or update EmulationStation themes. Most themes can be previewed at https://github.com/retropie/ RetroPie-Setup/wiki/themes.

game.name: Raspi-Config
game.desc: Change user password, boot options, internationalization, camera, add your pi to Rastrack, overclock, overscan, memory split, SSH and more.

game.name: Overclock
game.desc: Overclock settings for your RPI3 and RPI3B+.

game.name: Dreamcast date/time fix
game.desc: Enable or disable dreamcast date/time set on launching rom.

game.name: Shaders
game.desc: Retroach shaders.

game.name: Retroarch
game.desc: Launches the RetroArch GUI so you can change RetroArch options. Note: Changes will not be saved unless you have enabled the "Save Configuration On Exit" option.

game.name: Retroarch Bezels
game.desc:
This script will enable or disable the use of bezel overlays for Retroarch based emulators.
Bezel overlays and config files are here: /opt/retropie/configs/all/retroarch/overlay
Retroarch config files are here: /opt/retropie/configs/(emulator)/retroarch.cfg
This script will update the retroarch config files to use the designated named bezel config file.

game.name: Retropie reset utility
game.desc: EmulationStation and attract mode reset to default setting utility.

game.name: Jukebox Configuration
game.desc: Configuration utility for the Fruitbox jukebox.

game.name: RetroPie Video Loading screen
game.desc: Enable or Disable video loading screen.

game.name: Kodi Repair
game.desc: This script will repair kodi launching(emulator.cfg on retropie/configs).

game.name: Bezel Project
game.desc: Download and manage games bezels.

game.name: Background Music
game.desc:
The mpg123 music script has been installed in this build to play MP3/WAV files during menu navigation in both Emulation Station and Attract Mode.
A special folder in /roms has been created called music. This folder is used to place your MP3/WAV files into. Once done, restart the system and they will begin automatically playing.
Once you launch a game, the music will stop. Upon exiting out of a game, the music will begin playing again.

game.name: Splash Screens
game.desc: Enable or disable the splashscreen on RetroPie boot. Choose a splashscreen, download new splashscreens, and return splashscreen to default.

game.name: RetroPie Setup
game.desc: Install RetroPie from binary or source, install experimental packages, additional drivers, edit samba shares, custom scraper, as well as other RetroPie-related configurations.

game.name: Show IP
game.desc: Displays your current IP address, as well as other information provided by the command, "ip addr show."

game.name: WiFi
game.desc: Connect to or disconnect from a wifi network and configure wifi settings.
